awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  BlockReduce: Scaling Public Blockchains for Enterprise Applications
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project is to transform the manner in which people and entities engage in transfer of value.   In our current economy, many businesses operate as middlemen between the producer of a good or service and the consumer of that good or service. Examples of such businesses can be categorized as financial services, exchange services, and regulated utilities. These intermediaries create a large inefficiency on producers, consumers, and the economy as a whole. Many of these businesses can be replaced partly or in whole by open source public blockchains. Over time, open-source public blockchains will competitively evolve to deliver the highest economic value for all market participants at the lowest cost. Although blockchain technology has enormous promise to positively impact society, current public blockchains have not been able to scale sufficiently to meet the needs of most enterprise applications.


This SBIR Phase I project proposes to develop BlockReduce: a scalable, trustless, public blockchain for enterprise applications. BlockReduce presents a new blockchain topology to offer 3+ orders of magnitude improvement in transaction throughput while avoiding the introduction of hierarchical power structures and centralization. Additionally, BlockReduce is able to provide low-cost transactions with stable fees, which is key to enabling countless enterprise applications. By answering the issues of scale, cost, and access to public blockchains, BlockReduce will be the catalyst for enterprises moving from proof-of-concept (PoC) blockchain demonstrations to full scale deployments. If successful, BlockReduce could serve as fundamental infrastructure for digital value exchanges much like ethernet was technological infrastructure for digital information exchange.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Outcomes of this project include the development of a new scalable
blockchain protocol called BlockReduce. BlockReduce identifies the
primary source of poor scalability in current blockchain systems, in
particular, the challenges introduced by latency in the network in
enabling decentralized consensus at scale. BlockReduce solves this by
incentivizing a hierarchical clustered model for the network,
comprised of zones, regions and prime, with prime being the top of the
hierarchy and zones being the smallest elemental unit. By combining
merged mining with this hierarchical architecture, we enable a
scalable public permissionless blockchain solution that combines high
transaction throughput with low fees.  This grant enabled our team to build a proof-of-concept (PoC) golang implementation of BlockReduce.  This PoC enabled the team to test and refine the peering, transaction, and communication architecture. Ultimately, the implementation of BlockReduce was tested using simulated network conditions meant to replicate the measured performance of Bitcoin network nodes and demonstrated more than 7,000 transactions per second.  The PoC has been turned into a public blockchain network called the Quai Network which is currently running its second public test network.  

Intellectual Merit: Scalability is one of the most desirable
properties of blockchain systems. Currently, the most well known proof
of work chains suffer from poor transaction scalability, resulting in
high transaction fees. Through the design of a scalable proof of work
blockchain, we enable low transaction fees and therefore, more
efficient means to enable human-commerce at scale. Our hierarchical
architecture is unique in that it retains the core security from proof
of work while enabling latency-based clustering, thus increasing the
transaction rate without increasing fees.

Broader Impact:  Blockchains enable decentralized commerce in a manner
not conceived before. However, scalability has been one of its biggest
challenges, with transactions fees reaching tens to hundreds of
dollars at times. Solutions for scalability including new consensus
mechanisms such as proof of stake, or new Layer 2 protocols such as
polygon. With BlockReduce, this scalable challenge is addressed head
on with proof of work security without the need for Layer 2 protocols.
This scalability enables decentralized commerce at scale for humans
and machines in a manner not thought possible before.
